class.name: BuildingBlockTypeItem
class.description: Represents a type of building block in a Word document.

properties.name: categories
properties.description: Returns a BuildingBlockCategoryCollection object that represents the categories for a building block type.

examples.description: Get and display all category names for the "General" building block type.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a BuildingBlockTypeItem to verify the connection between the add-in and Word before performing operations on building blocks.

properties.name: index
properties.description: Returns the position of an item in a collection.

examples.description: Get the position of the first building block type in the collection and display it in the console.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Returns the localized name of a building block type.

examples.description: Display the localized name of the first building block type in the document to the console.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and display the name property of a building block type from the first gallery in the document.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.BuildingBlockTypeItem object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.BuildingBlockTypeItemData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Retrieve a building block type item and serialize it to JSON format for logging or data transfer purposes.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track a building block type item across multiple sync calls to prevent "InvalidObjectPath" errors when accessing its properties after document changes.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Access a building block type, use it to retrieve information, then untrack it to free memory after you're done working with it.
